subject: misleading  shell exit status when a single test class name is supplied, and is not found ( '0 tests' case )
msgSnippet: If junit4 is asked to run a single test but cannot find the test class, It will exit with a shell success status instead of the expected shell failure status:
messageBody:
If junit4 is asked to run a single test but cannot find the test class,

It will exit with a shell success status instead of the expected shell
failure status:

(yes, it's a fairly trivial boundary case)



java org.junit.runner.JUnitCore apitest.ApiTesV1Ticket

JUnit version 4.1

Could not find class: apitest.ApiTesV1Ticket



Time: 0.001



OK (0 tests)



vmsvr1>echo $?

0







[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
